result.execSummary:
The defendant John Carl Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court granted credit for 5 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample, and pay all mandatory costs, fees, DNA surcharge within one year or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.

- No Contact with any Walmarts.
- No Contact with Dawayne W.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Carl Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Carl Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 5 DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR with the following conditions:
*No contact with any Walmarts
*No contact with Dawayne W. 
*pay all mandatory costs, fees, dna surcharges, give DNA sample within one year or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. lr

Defendant John Carl Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-01-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart.

Defendant John Carl Jones in court with Student Intern Michelle Cahoon under the supervision of attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant John Carl Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
